Title:
Three new Russula species in sect. Ingratae (Russulales,
Basidiomycota) from southern China
Keywords:
Agaricomycetes, ITS, morphology, phylogeny, Russulaceae,
taxonomy
Abstract:
Three species of Russula section Ingratae, namely R.
straminella, R. subpectinatoides and R. succinea gathered from Guizhou
Province, southwestern China, are proposed new to science. Photographs,
line drawings, and detailed morphological descriptions for these species
were provided and compared against closely related taxa. The
phylogenetic analyses of internal transcribed spacer (ITS) region also
supported the independences of these new species. Russula indocatillus
are first report for China; morphological and phylogenetic data in
detail are provided based on the Chinese specimens.
